**Set Up Zotero**

<details class="collapsible">
<summary>Download and Install Zotero (Recommended before the workshop)</summary>

- Go to [Zotero.org/download](https://www.zotero.org/download/)

<details class="collapsible">
<summary>Install the Zotero Connector (Recommended before the workshop)</summary>


- [Download the Zotero Connector](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/zotero-connector/ekhagklcjbdpajgpjgmbionohlpdbjgc) for your browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, or Safari).

<details class="collapsible">

- Go to [Zotero.org](https://www.zotero.org/user/register/)
- Sign up for a free account (needed for syncing your library across devices).

</details>



<details class="collapsible">
<summary> Sync Your Library (Recommended before the workshop)</summary>

- Open the Zotero desktop app.
- Go to Edit ‚Üí Preferences ‚Üí Sync.
- Enter your Zotero account details and enable syncing.

</details>

### Part C: AI-Enhanced Literature Review

**STORM - Stanford University**

- AI-powered research assistant 
  - Draft the article 


Sign In [STORM](https://storm.genie.stanford.edu/)



**NotebookLM.google** 

- AI-powered research assistant 
  - organize 
  - analyze  
  - generate insights

Source-grounded summaries ‚Äì provides explanations and answers based only on the materials you upload (PDFs, Google Docs, etc.), 

**Adventages**
- Reducing the risk of hallucinations.
- Everything is traceable back to your uploaded sources.


**Getting Started with NotebookLM (Google)**

<details class="collapsible">
<summary> NotebookLM </summary>
- Sign In 
  - Go to notebooklm.google
  - Sign in with your Google account (Gmail)
- Create a New Notebook
  - Click ‚ÄúNew Notebook‚Äù
  - Give your notebook a name (e.g., Research Project, Thesis Review)
- Upload Sources
  - Add Google Docs, PDFs, or web-page
  - NotebookLM will build an AI model grounded only in your sources
- Ask Questions
  - Use the chat box to ask questions.
  - Example: ‚ÄúSummarize Chapter 2 in 5 bullet points‚Äù or ‚ÄúCompare methods A and B‚Äù
- Generate Insights
  - Get summaries, outlines, or concept maps
- NotebookLM Audios Overviews
  - AI-Generated Summary Audios

</details>
